## 1

```{r}
a <- 1
b <- 3
c <- 2

insqrt <- b^2-4*a*c

if (insqrt < 0){
  print("No real solution")
} else{
  sol1 <- (-b + sqrt(insqrt))/(2*a)
  sol2 <- (-b - sqrt(insqrt))/(2*a)
  sol1
  sol2
}
```

## 2

```{r}
x <- seq(-5, 5, length = 300)
plot(x, a*x^2 + b*x +c, type = "l")
abline(h = 0, lty = 2)
```

This plot shows the curve $ax^2+bx+c=0$ and the stright line for $y=0$. If there has solution for the above equation, the curve will have intersection with the line.
